textBeforeTable: Bakugan Battle Brawlers appeals the most to male tweens (10-12 year olds) and young male teenagers (13-15 year olds). I think Yu-Gi-Oh!. While I watched the show, I felt like I was watching a derivative work that didn't have a lot of logistical thought put into it. Pokemon and Bakugan Battle Brawlers ultimately came across to me as a property trying to cash in on the popularity of other monster battle shows such as Bakugan Battle Brawlers, I also had problems being able to use my "willing suspension of disbelief." irst, when these mysterious cards are falling out of the sky, how come the government or the police didn't get involved? Also, now knowing from my research that Dan co-created the Bakugan game, how come he's ranked so low, and how come something that takes place in the first battle we see takes him so much by surprise? When watching The fact that there are no clear rules stated in the first two episodes is not only confusing for adults, but it is also going to be confusing for children. As an adult, I was frustrated enough with trying to figure out what I was watching, so I can imagine the frustration a child will experience.
